services moduleÔÉÅ

async services.authenticate_user(email: str, password: str, db: Session)[source]ÔÉÅ

Verify if a user exists within the DB and if their password matches with what‚Äôs stored in the DB.

ParametersÔÉÅ

email: str

An email in plain text sent by the front-end.

password: str

A password in plain text sent by the front-end.

db: Session

A DB session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

user: Schemas.Employee | False

Returns an employee object if found in the DB, otherwise returns false.

async services.complete_task(task_id: int, db: Session)[source]ÔÉÅ

Change the complete status of a task to 1 if found in the DB, OW, raise a 404 HTTP exception.

ParametersÔÉÅ

task_id: int

A task‚Äôs id.

db: Session

A db session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

task: Schemas.Task

A task object found in the DB.

services.create_db()[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a .db file using the structures defined in models.py.

NotesÔÉÅ

Must delete the old .db file to avoid structure conflicts.

ExampleÔÉÅ

To use this function, navigate to the folder that contains services.py, and do the following:

$ python  # To enter python terminal.
>>> import services
>>> services.create_db() # This will create a .db file.
async services.create_sprint(sprint: SprintCreate, current_employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a sprint obj and insert it into the DB using the data sent by the front-end.

ParametersÔÉÅ

sprint: Schemas.SprintCreate

An object representing the data sent by the front-end whenever a user creates a sprint.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee.

db: Session

A DB session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

sprint_obj: Schemas.Sprint

A successfully created sprint object.

async services.create_supervisor(supervisor: SupervisorCreate, employee: Employee, db: Session)[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a supervisor whose id, LN, FN are taken from employee table since a supervisor is one of the employees.

ParametersÔÉÅ

supervisorschemas.SupervisorCreate

A template that represents user‚Äôs inputs and is used to create a supervisor.

employeeschemas.Employee

An employee object that‚Äôs retrieved from the database.

dbSession

A database session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

Supervisorschemas.Supervisor

The newly created supervisor.

async services.delete_supervisor(supervisor_id: int, db: Session)[source]ÔÉÅ

Find a supervisor in the DB with the given supervisor_id. If found, delete that specific supervisor and change the ‚Äòrole‚Äô of the associated employee to 0 (demote). OW, throw a 404 HTTP exception.

ParametersÔÉÅ

supervisor_id: int

An id of a supervisor.

db: Session

A DB session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

None

A task‚Äôs id.

db: Session

A DB Session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

None

async services.get_current_user(db: Session = Depends(get_db), token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))[source]ÔÉÅ
services.get_db()[source]ÔÉÅ

Retrieves a db session and close the db after each session.

NotesÔÉÅ

Always use as dependency injection to open a db session before modify/update data inside a .db file.

async services.get_sprint_by_id(sprint_id: int, current_employee: Employee, db: Session) → Sprint | None[source]ÔÉÅ

Find a sprint in the DB using the given sprint_id. If not found, raise a 404 HTTP exception. OW, return a Sprint Object.

ParametersÔÉÅ

A sprint‚Äôs id.

current_employee: Schemas.Employee

The current employee who‚Äôs signed in.

db: Session

A DB session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

async services.get_task_by_id(task_id: int, db: Session) → Task | None[source]ÔÉÅ

ParametersÔÉÅ

A DB session.

async services.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session)[source]ÔÉÅ

Does a SQL query to find a user with the given email and return the first result since email is a unique column, meaning users can‚Äôt create accounts using the same email.

ParametersÔÉÅ

email: str

User‚Äôs email.

db: Session

A database session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

user_obj: Schemas.Employee

An Employee object.

async services.get_user_by_id(id: int, db: Session)[source]ÔÉÅ

Does a SQL query using the given employee_id. If no user found, raise a 404 HTTP exception, otherwise, returns an Employee object found in the db using the given employee_id.

ParametersÔÉÅ

employee_id: int

An employee‚Äôs id.

db: Session

A db session.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

employee_obj: Schemas.Employee

An employee object found in the db with the given id.

services.verify_password(password: str, db_password: bytes) → bool[source]ÔÉÅ

Check whether hashed password and inputted password are the same.

ParametersÔÉÅ

password: str

User‚Äôs password in plain text (str).

db_password: bytes

The hashed password in bytes form, stored in the database.

ReturnsÔÉÅ

is_matched: bool

A bool indicates whether or not 2 given passwords are the same.
